fields.description: Atlassian Cloud REST APIs are rate limited. See details on rate limiting [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rate-limiting/]. Apps that are importing large data sets to cloud as part of a migration may hit rate limits which could slow or fail the migration.
fields.summary: Atlassian Cloud REST API Rate Limiting may impact reliability of app migrations

fields.description:
Dashboard entities are not migrated yet with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (see linked ticket). When they do migrate, dashboard gadgets created by apps will not work because they are missing a prefix required by the cloud version of the app to recognize the gadget. 

Workaround is to delete and recreate the dashboard gadget.
fields.summary: Dashboard gadgets created by apps do not work post migration

fields.description:
When a customer preps their cloud site by installing an app they want to migrate, the add-on user is added to the cloud site. After setting up their cloud site, when they migrate space and page content via the Confluence Cloud Migrations Assistant (CCMA) or via manual import of the Space, the add-on permissions are not updated for the imported space. This means the add-on will work in new spaces but not in migrated spaces. 

As a workaround, the customer would need to re-install the app on the cloud site post migration to have the add-on user added to space permissions for all spaces.  Or update the space add-on permissions.
fields.summary: Add-on users are not migrated with space permissions

fields.description: It would be great if JCMA had an option to STOP a plan similar to what we have in CCMA.
fields.summary: Add an option to stop a plan in JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we Migrate Project using Jira Migration assistance, The data gets migrated for all the projects first and then attachments are migrated.

Some time the Attachment Migration fails and in order to restart the migration, We need to Delete the project and then re-migrate, However, Some time it is not a feasible solution for the customer. 

So, If we have a way to migrate only attachment after migration of data using Jira Migration Assistane it will be helpful.
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding ability for Jira Migration assistance to migrate attachment after data Migraiton

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When customer tries to open the Confluence Migration Assistant, he gets error message in a pop-up:

We can't communicate with your server

Customer must have a list of Migration attempts beforehand. The issue only happens after having several test attempts visible in the Migrations dashboard
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Confluence Administration Menu
 # Click on Migration Assistant
 # Considering there were migrations attempts already made, the Migration Assistant will display the Migrations dashboard first thing. (empty CCMA takes you to the CCMA Home screen)
 # Wait for it to try loading the screen/table view until you get the pop-up error message
 # Additional behaviour that can happen is the never ending load of the Migration dashboard or just partial loading with the load spinning also happening

h3. Expected Results

The Migrations dashboard screen should open normally
h3. Actual Results

The Migrations dashboard screen either tries to load the list of migration attempts indefinitely or it loads partial information and stays attempting to load the rest indefinitely as well

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2020-11-04 23:46:40,712 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-1043] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: class java.util.HashSet cannot be cast to class java.util.List (java.util.HashSet and java.util.List are in module java.base of loader 'bootstrap')
 -- referer: http://confluence.mycompany.com:8090/admin/migration.action | url: /rest/migration/latest/plan | traceId: f7c251d78569b440 | userName: admin@mycompany.com
java.lang.ClassCastException: class java.util.HashSet cannot be cast to class java.util.List (java.util.HashSet and java.util.List are in module java.base of loader 'bootstrap')
	at com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.check.space.SpaceConflictChecker.retrieveConflictingSpaces(SpaceConflictChecker.java:71)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, the only alternative available once CCMA breaks like that, is to reset it to "factory default". The KB informing this alternative can be found below. Of course, this is not a workaround customers are looking for and a bug fix must be in place as soon as possible
 * [Restore the Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence to the default version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/restore-the-cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-to-the-default-version-974378747.html]
fields.summary: [CCMA] Accessing the Migration Assistant inside Confluence gives error msg "We can't communicate with your server"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using Jira Cloud Migration assistant, the app assessment does not list Tempo Timesheets as an installed app

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Use the app assessment function in the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant app

h3. Expected Results

Tempo Timesheets is listed as an installed app allowing users to add notes and make decisions regarding the app migration

h3. Actual Results

Tempo Timesheets is not listed as an installed app

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: App assessment does not list Tempo Timesheets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate a workflow using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

h3. Expected Results

The workflow and it's scheme including all transitions, statuses, workflow post-functions/conditions/validators/triggers are migrated
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Only the workflow functions listed on this page are migrated:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html{noformat}

fields.description: For enterprise customers uploading attachments can take days if not weeks. Its seem odd that we have to re-upload the same set of files once during UAT and then during the prod migration. It would be nice if the files uploaded in UAT could be used during the prod migration and we had to just re-upload the delta.
fields.summary: Re-use UAT attachments for a prod migration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a plan for JCMA to migrate Jira projects from Server to Cloud, if you have a large project with lots of issues, the pre-check report will continue to run even if you back out of the plan.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new plan to migrate a project using JCMA
# Go all the way until the end but don't trigger the migration
# Check the tail -f atlassian-jira.log
# The pre-check report will be running
# If you back out of the plan, the pre-check will still be running 

h3. Expected Results

Going back would halt the pre-check report from running.

h3. Actual Results

The logs will keep going even if you don't trigger the plan to migrate, this is especially bad for large projects with lots of issues.  

The below references is shown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

{noformat}
2020-11-12 13:57:15,397+0000 pool-47-thread-45 WARN localadmin 836x3873x2 xxxxxx xxxxxxxx /rest/migration/latest/check/dfc5b72a82245c4cf6476ae7ca1e5d9352603c4e [c.a.j.m.e.core.issue.ChangeGroupExporter$CloudChangeItemConverter] Skipping CustomField change com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean@3b37a708[fieldType=custom,field=Document as,from=10305,fromString=xxxxxxxx xxxxx,to=10306,toString=xxx xxxxx xxxxx,created=2015-11-26 09:26:05.0] on Issue XXXXX-962 as we can't identify its source issue field
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

No workaround, for now, when one is available we will publish here, feel to contact [support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com] if you need assistance.
fields.summary: JCMA Pre-check report doesn't stop running when backing out of a plan

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When first importing users with the help of Atlassian support, the subsequent portion of data (without users, groups, and group memberships), will cause the import to fail due to the 'GroupAttribute' entries present in the entities.xml file.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the error message on the UI so that users can identify this problem better.

h3. Notes
Stack trace:
{code}com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: Sync Failed
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdDirectoryServiceImpl.synchroniseDirectory(CrowdDirectoryServiceImpl.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceProxy.synchroniseDirectory(CrowdServiceProxy.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.performMigration(IdentityImportHelper.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:514)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:631)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.lambda$null$1(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:261)
	at com.atlassian.connpool.impl.AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:155)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$null$0(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:63)
	at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$runWithSeparateContextAsync$1(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:62)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1604)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught BatchUpdateException for insert into "public"."cwd_group_attributes" ("directory_id", "group_id", "lower_attribute_value", "attribute_name", "attribute_value")
values (?, ?, ?, ?, ?){code}

h3. Workaround
We should include the SED commands that are usually used by this approach with the one to remove the group attributes from the entities.xml file. The list below has all the commands that should be used for this type of situation. 

{panel:title=MacOS}
{code}
sed -i '' '/<User id="/d' entities.xml 
sed -i '' '/<Group id="/d' entities.xml 
sed -i '' '/<Membership id="/d' entities.xml 
sed -i '' '/<GroupAttribute id="/d' entities.xml
{code}
{panel}

{panel:title=Linux}
{code}
sed -i '/<User id="/d' entities.xml 
sed -i '/<Group id="/d' entities.xml 
sed -i '/<Membership id="/d' entities.xml 
sed -i '/<GroupAttribute id="/d' entities.xml
{code}
{panel}
fields.summary: Cloud to Cloud site import mail fail due to 'GroupAttribute' entries in entities.xml file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Storage details in User management showing incorrect size after partially migrating attachments

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira server backup
 # Migrate to cloud using site-import
# Don't import any attachments

h3. Expected Results
Storage option in cloud user management should show 0GB used

h3. Actual Results
Storage option in cloud user management should shows ___GB used 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Additional Details
Storage option seems to be calculating based on the entries in the database and not the actual files uploaded to cloud.
fields.summary: Storage details in User management showing incorrect size after partially migrating attachments

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing to the Cloud, the import fails on the validation stage with this error:
{code}
Import error

There was an error importing file jira-export (4).zip: Validation failed. Following issues were reported:
Cannot complete the import because one of the import files contains the following duplicate workflows: 'workflow 1'. Search the Atlassian Administrator Knowledge Base for instructions on how to fix this, or contact Atlassian Support for help.
{code}

This happens when there are Workflows with the same name in the Backup file. By right, workflows may not have the same name; Jira will not allow this through the UI. However, if the Workflow names has the same name but with different letter case, for example:
- "workflow 1"
- "WORKFLOW 1"

Jira will allow this to happen. However, generating a backup, and restoring this to a Cloud instance will fail on the validation stage.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two Workflows, they may remain Inactive.
# Rename the first workflow as "workflow 1".
# Rename the second workflow also as "workflow 1".
#- Notice that Jira does not allow the second workflow to has the same name
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
# Proceed to rename the second workflow to "Workflow 1". This should go through.
# Now, generate a backup, and use this to import to a Cloud instance.

h3. Expected Results
The import should go through, as Jira seems to allow the same workflow name but with different casing.

h3. Actual Results
The import fails on the validation stage:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
# This can also be resolved by not allowing the same workflow name but with different casing.
# This affects both, Cloud to Cloud, and Server to Cloud.
# There might also be occurrences where the duplicated workflow has the same name with the same casing, however, it is currently unknown on how it gets to this state.

h3. Diagnostics
{code}
select lower(workflowname), count(lower(workflowname)) from jiraworkflows group by lower(workflowname) having count(lower(workflowname)) > 1;
{code}

h3. Workaround
Delete or Rename one of the duplicate workflow on the Source instance, generate a new backup, and use the new backup to import.
fields.summary: Duplicated Workflows in the backup file causes import to fail

fields.description:
After a successful Cloud migration, administrators may want to place their Server instance in read-only mode to prevent accidental edits to pages on Server. 

h3. Methods
* Data Center implements a "Read Only" mode for site maintenance. This would be useful for CCMA to enable after a full-instance migration
* A permission scheme that only allows "Browse" is recommended by the migration documentation. Having an option for CCMA to enable this on migrated spaces after a successful migration would help for partially-migrated instances

h3. Additional notes
* MIG-45 discusses another feature that pairs with this request: redirecting requests from a migrated instance to the new/destination instance
fields.summary: Read-Only mode for Confluence after migration

fields.description: It would be great if space migrations in CCMA could run in parallel, for some of the larger customers this is running into days if not weeks.
fields.summary: Parallelise space migrations in CCMA to make them faster

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom content objects are not being imported during server to cloud migrations. Custom content objects have no specific prefix in server, but a prefix of 'ac:' in cloud. For example, a server app may have a custom content object {{app-foo-document-for-confluence:document}} but the cloud version of the app will have a custom content object {{ac:app-foo-document-for-confluence:document}}.

When exporting spaces on server and importing them into cloud (which is what the migration assistant does by default), the {{ac:}} prefix is not added to the custom content objects. As a result, the documents are not picked up by the APIs and therefore not available in the cloud version of the app.

Atlassian should take care of adding this prefix as part of the Migration assistant task.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Scroll Documents on Confluence server
 # Create a document in any space from the Document Library
 # Migrate the space to a cloud instance using the Atlassian Migration Assistant

h3. Expected Results

The Document should be available in the Document Library of the space on Cloud.
h3. Actual Results

The Document is not available in the Document Library on Cloud.
h3. Workaround

The following workaround exists, but is not scalable:
 # Create a space export from server that has a Scroll Document created
 # Unzip the space export zip file
 # In the {{entities.xml}} file manually add the prefix to all occurrences of the custom content instances in the {{CustomContentEntityObject}} object
{code:xml}
    <property name="pluginModuleKey"><![CDATA[ac:k15t-scroll-document-versions-for-confluence:document]]></property>
    {code}

 # Repackage the space export archive
 # Import to Cloud 

h3. Notes

Although the fix for this issue will migrate custom app CONTENT data, it does not resolve any permission issues that may be required for the App via Connect. Please watch [MIG\-303: Add\-on users are not migrated with space permissions|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-303] for updates for a fix for the permissions issue.
fields.summary: Custom content objects are not being imported during server to cloud migrations

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In both assistants for Confluence and Jira, there is no counter for elapsed time for each plan, it's important to know how long it took to migrate during the test, so users can prepare for the production migration.
fields.summary: Add an elapsed time counter for Plans in CCMA and JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While trying to run a Jira Site Import, a Null Pointer Exception is triggered during XML Validation Phase.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a XML Export on Jira Software Server.
# Upload it to Jira Software Cloud.

h3. Expected Results
Validation of the file goes through and import is successful.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is observed on UI:
{noformat}
Error importing data: java.lang.NullPointerException
{noformat}

Backend logs as follow:
{code}
cloud.atlassian.logmon.laas.api.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AnonymousAccessValidator$EntityInfo.<init>(AnonymousAccessValidator.java:314)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AnonymousAccessValidator.visit(AnonymousAccessValidator.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.FeedbackEntityVisitorContainer.lambda$visit$0(FeedbackEntityVisitorContainer.java:22)

{code}

None.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

During the Jira site import, the XML validation takes a long time and after that the site import also take time (both proceed together take between 20 to 36 hours)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take an XML backup of the Jira server ( the backup > 600mb + )
 # Import this backup to the Jira cloud using the Jira import method.
 # If the backup file is greater than 600MB then the XML validation takes anywhere between 6 to 8 hours.
 # After this, the import takes between 15 to 28 hours.

h3. Expected Results

The Jira import should not take such a long time. The import to be done within 8 hours max.
h3. Actual Results:

It has been observed that the import takes 20 to 36 hours,
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: XML validation during Jira site import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a site import in Jira from Server/DC, if you have external directories synced, during the first validation you might see the following error:

!Screen Shot 2020-10-01 at 5.02.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Sync Jira Server with an external directory
# Generate a backup for Jira
# Do a site import in Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results

The import goes to the next screen, allowing the import to go through.

h3. Actual Results

This error is presented in the URL and the following error is throw in the backend.

 !Screen Shot 2020-10-01 at 5.02.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Logs found in the Cloud backend:

{noformat}
Could not find definition for entity name DirectorySynchronisationStatus
     stack: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericModelException: Could not find definition for entity name DirectorySynchronisationStatus
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.model.ModelReader.getModelEntity(ModelReader.java:313)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.getModelEntity(GenericDelegator.java:297)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDelegator.makeValue(GenericDelegator.java:475)
.......
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Remove the following attributes from the entities.xml, and your backup should get through:

macOS
{code}
sed '' -i '/<DirectorySynchronisationToken id="/d' entities.xml
sed '' -i '/<DirectorySynchronisationStatus id="/d' entities.xml
{code}

Linux
{code}
sed -i '/<DirectorySynchronisationToken id="/d' entities.xml
sed -i '/<DirectorySynchronisationStatus id="/d' entities.xml
{code}

If you are not comfortable with this approach, please, [reach out to support|https://support.atlassian.com/].
fields.summary: Validation fail during Jira site import with "Could not find definition for entity name DirectorySynchronisation"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a Jira site import, the import may fail during the user processing phase, the error message is not clear in the UI. However, the stack error indicates there is a throttling happening in the backend or socketTimouts, usually, this specific problem happens with large user bases.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a backup
 # Perform a site import

h3. Expected Results

Import completes successfully
h3. Actual Results

Import fails with the following generic message in the UI:

!Screen Shot 2020-10-27 at 20.20.31.png|thumbnail!

*Note:* This is a generic error message to confirm the real issue, support needs to investigate the backend logs.

The exception can be seen in the backend logs. Note that there seem to be multiple manifestations of the same issue through different errors. 
{noformat}
com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.ThrottledException: { "error" : "Too many requests. Please inspect Retry-After header." }
com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapStatusCodeException(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:519)
com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.mapInputStream(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:461)
com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.makeRequestWithEntityBody(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:435)
com.atlassian.idp.client.IdentityPlatformClientImpl.createGroup(IdentityPlatformClientImpl.java:313)
{noformat}


{noformat}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: javax.net.ssl.SSLException: Socket closed
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.withRetry(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:313)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.importUserReturningExisting(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:233)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.UsersOperations.lambda$createNewUserWithGroupMemberships$20(UsersOperations.java:483)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.retry.Retryer$Retriable.call(Retryer.java:94){noformat}
h3. Workaround

Front-load the users using a script, [contact support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/] strip the users from the entities.xml.
fields.summary: Site import fails during the user/groups synchronization phase

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A new user can not be added/invited directly after Jira Site Import. An administrator have to Approve/Reject groups product access in the Admin panel. While inviting the User the error message created on the UI is not clear.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a Jira Site import.
 # Once import is completed, create a new user. (*Without approving any groups in the Product Access*)
 [https://admin.atlassian.com/s/<Cloud ID>/users|https://admin.atlassian.com/s/%3CCloud%20ID%3E/users]
 # You will get an error in UI. 

{code:java}
Could not add users{code}
{code:java}
 Unable to add user{code}
!image-2020-10-22-17-55-08-164.png|width=402,height=160!  

Expected Results

(on) The users should get a correct error message on the UI which could lead them to product group access. 
h3. Actual Results

User get different error messages:

(!) Error One:
 !image-2020-10-22-18-01-49-512.png!

(!)Error Two:
 !image-2020-10-22-18-03-11-527.png|width=402,height=160!
h3. Workaround

Users raise a support ticket to Atlassian to fix this error.
fields.summary: Show clear error message while inviting users directly after Jira site import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On some occasions, JCMA might skip the issue of history migration because the values for that field are not recognized by JCMA. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a migration plan.
# Select some projects to migrate.
# Run the migration.

h3. Expected Results

JCMA should advise the user about these inconsistencies.

h3. Actual Results

The migration finishes without issues but in the JIRA application logs you should see WARN entries like the below:
{code}
2020-07-24 03:38:06,370 pool-6143-thread-4 WARN test@user.com 206x3133x1 l2ovl5 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [c.a.j.m.e.core.issue.ChangeGroupExporter$CloudChangeItemConverter] Skipping CustomField change com.atlassian.jira.issue.history.ChangeItemBean@f3a100c[fieldType=custom,field=Sprint,from=2089, 2157,fromString=Sprint1,Sprint2,to=2089, 2157, 2222,toString=Sprint1,Sprint2,Sprint3 and st,created=2016-03-30 07:39:58.49] on Issue KEY-1241 as we can't identify its source issue field
{code}

Comparing the issue history in both Cloud and Server you will be able to see the missing entries:
 !server-history.png|thumbnail! 
 !cloud-history.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

* The WARN entries might be logged for [unsupported|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html] custom fields.
* The final value of the affected custom fields is maintained, just the issue history is affected.

 h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: JCMA skips custom field changes in issue history

fields.description:
It would be great if CCMA could generate a report post-migration with the following information:
* Time taken to Migrate the entire Plan
* Time taken to Migrate each of the Spaces
* Number of attachments migrated on each of the Spaces
fields.summary: Space/Plan Migration Statistics in CCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a migration plan with JCMA if your container token(token create when you log in through JCMA and select your site) is expired the migration checks will fail.
h3. Expected Results

JCMA should advise the user that the token is expired and request a new login to renew it.
h3. Actual Results

JCMA allows the user to select a site and fails the pre-migration checks with a maintenance message because of the expired token:
 !image-2020-10-20-19-29-08-157.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # Create a new plan in JCMA.
 # When you advance to the next screen, click on "Choose Cloud Site" JCMA will redirect you to the Cloud.
 # A drop-down menu will appear so you can select the Cloud site.
 # And you should be able to proceed with the migration.
fields.summary: Expired token causes JCMA to throw a maintenance message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating projects with JCMA, in theory, the add-on should only migrate the entities related to the selected projects. This also means that only the statuses being referenced in these project workflows should be imported which is not the current behavior.

Right now, when a project is migrated via JCMA all instance statuses are migrated to the Cloud site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sample project.
# Create extra statuses and make sure they are not related to the project's workflow.
# Migrate the project with JCMA.

h3. Expected Results

JCMA should only migrate the statuses related to the workflow from the project being migrated.

h3. Actual Results

JCMA migrates all server statuses into the Cloud.

h3. Workaround

Delete the unwanted statuses after the migration has been finished.
fields.summary: All statuses are migrated with JCMA
Issues with sprint history get incorrect format on the cloud database

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update: 6 October 2021}
Hi everyone,

We understand the need and importance of supporting the requirements of this suggestion ticket.

The work to develop a solution to support the migration of Insight data isn't yet on the roadmap, but we anticipate this happening in 2022. We'll provide a further update when there's more clarity on timings.

Thank you for your patience.

Caroline Bartle | Product Manager, Jira Service Management
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, there is no option to migrate all data from Insight For Jira from Server to the cloud.
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Support the export/import of Insight for Jira data
 * Ability to migrate Insight for Jira data using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant
 * Ability to migrate Insight for Jira data using full Jira XML export/Import

h3. Why this is important
 * Insight for Jira is largely used in Server environments and several customers relly heavily on its features
 * When we perform the migration from Server to Cloud, we are hoping to minimize the data loss after the migration.
fields.summary: Support the migration of Insight for Jira data

fields.description:
h3. The App Assessment table uses the macro usage macro to populate usage data in the "Appears on" and "Viewed by" columns. Apps that do not use macros appear to have "not applicable" usage. This could be misleading when performing an app assessment and using data displayed in those columns to understand app usage. 

h3. Affected apps include: 
*  [Comala Document Management|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/142/comala-document-management?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview] (also known as Comala Workflows)
* Others

h3. Workaround
Marketplace Partners may be able to advise on how to assess app usage for non-macro based apps. 

For example: With Comala Document Management it is possible to query the Confluence Database to get the number of spaces/ pages with workflows enabled using this CQL Query: “cql=awphasworkflow+%3D+%22true%22”
fields.summary: Viewing app usage on App Assessment table displays "not applicable" for apps that are not macro based

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a Cloud to Cloud migration site import may fail during the plugin data processing. This is happening due to a duplicated entry in the Jira Service Desk CSAT table, probably related to this JSD bug: [JSDCLOUD-5674|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-5674]


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Jira Service Desk Cloud
# Create a full backup
# Import on another Cloud instance

h3. Expected Results

The import goes through successfully.

h3. Actual Results

 !Screen Shot 2020-10-13 at 2.25.47 PM.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the Cloud backend logs:

{noformat}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "u_ao_54307e_csatsearchindex_issue_id"
  Detail: Key ("ISSUE_ID")=(xxxxx) already exists.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

[Contact Cloud support |https://getsupport.atlassian.com/] to clear out the duplicated entries for the issues.

h3. Note

Currently this bug was only noticed in Cloud to Cloud migration with JSD, it doesn't necessarily mean all Cloud customers who have JSD will be affected.
fields.summary: Site import fails in the processing plugin data phase

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant is able to migrate inline tasks, when there is a very large volume of inline tasks, the method is inefficient + ends up timing out.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Load up a test of a space migration with > 5000 pages with inline issues

h3. Expected Results

Space and its pages migrate successfully without losing inline task data.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
Migration of the space timesout and fails...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Inline tasks fail to migrate at very large volumes

fields.description:
Currently, both the Jira and Confluence Cloud Migration Assistants will insist on having users with invalid email address or duplicate usernames with the same email address fixed prior to proceeding with the migration (exception is when No users & groups is selected with the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant).

For various reasons, some admins do not need / want to fix these and clear the blocking pre-flight checks. Examples may be.
 * When users have left the company, it no longer makes sense to have to fix their email address and have them created in Cloud
 * There are thousands of user preflight checks and the time / effort to fix these is high but data loss is likely to be very low to nil.
 * Users are not relevant to the migration as they come from external directories.

 

This feature would be providing an option for the blocking pre-flight check to be converted in to a softer pre-flight check, where the user could dismiss the invalid/duplicate user preflights. These users would then be migrated as anonymous users.
h3. Suggested workaround for Jira

We have shipped a feature in the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant that automatically scopes referenced users for the projects selected. As this feature more accurately scopes users relevant to the selected projects, it should reduce the number of preflight checks on users who don't need to be migrated with the selected projects.

For instructions on this see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-141
fields.summary: I would like the option to dismiss user preflight checks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using JCMA to migrate individual projects to the cloud, users may see this 
 error:

*Multiple users have the same email address*
This is caused by the duplicate email check failed when the username has some upper case characters and some project data contains both user-refs and export treats them as two different user keys
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # access JCMA GUI [<Server_URL>/secure/migration-app-action.jspa#/plan-configuration|#/plan-configuration]
 # select "chose what to migrate"
 # select "Projects, users and groups"
 # select desired projects
 # select "Only users and groups related to the selected projects"
 # select "Preserve Group Membership"
 # users should see the ERROR *"Multiple users have the same email address"*

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to complete the migration of individual projects via JCMA
h3. Actual Results

Users may see this error:

*Multiple users have the same email address*
h3. Workaround

User should migrate all the users/groups separately, then, via XML import, manually migrate the projects
fields.summary: Duplicate email check failed when username has some upper case characters

fields.description:
*Suggestion*

Standardize JCMA/CCMA emails validations to align with Cloud accepted emails. Sometimes we see migrations fail due to invalid emails that pass the JCMA/CCMA email validation. Some examples are emails with commas or emails that have the domain example.com

It would make it a better user experience if these pre-checks captured these emails instead of waiting for the migration to fail after a few mins/hours.

Additionally, please document the exact validation rules we use so that admins can self help and clean emails in a less reactive way.
fields.summary: Standardize JCMA/CCMA emails validations to align with Cloud accepted emails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As per mentioned [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html], JCMA only migrate filters related to the boards from the projects you're migrating. 

This means that right now, the global filters used by other entities like gadgets won't be migrated at all.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance JCMA so it can migrate all instance filters and not just the filters related to the project boards.

h3. Why this is important

When performing the entire migration via JCMA having to re-create all the global filters in Cloud can be quite toilsome depending on the number of filters you had in server.
fields.summary: Add support to migrate global filters

fields.description:
h2. Problem Summary

Project migration usually begins with a test migration.

The test may be iterated on several times
 * to work through failure or incomplete migrations, as advised by the error logs
 * to run tests with a handful of users to get feedback and check the experience and data is migrated correctly
 * to now move from a test migration phase to production migration phase

h2. Suggestion
 * Copy the contents/projects of saved or completed migration to a new plan

 * Edit the projects in a plan

 * Change the target site for a plan

 * Copy a successful test plan and point it to a production site

 * Clean up the dashboard so only the required plans are visible

 * At pre-flight checks, go away and fix any issues and resume creating the plan later.
fields.summary: It would be super helpful to easily re-run a (failed or successful) migration.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

All fields (custom or standard) will always be migrated (if supported) or come up in the pre-migration report (if unsupported), even though it is not referenced by a selected project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Example 1: Supported standard field
 # Change a standard field from Global to being used by 0 projects
 # Ensure that the field is used in 0 screens
 # Migrate a project
 # Observe that this standard field is still migrated even though it was not referenced in the project data

Example 2: Supported custom field
 # Ensure there is a supported custom field type configured in the Jira Server instance
 # Migrate a project which does not have this custom field referenced in the data
 # Observe that the custom field is still migrated even though it was not referenced in the project data

Example 3: Unsupported custom field
 # Ensure there is an unsupported custom field type configured in the Jira Server instance
 # Migrate a project which does not have this custom field referenced in the data
 # Observe that the unsupported custom fields is reported in the 'Pre-migration report' as it is considered part of the data set _(Note: the report is still in development)_

h3. Expected Results

For selected projects:
 * Only migrate referenced standard fields. 
 * Only migrate referenced custom fields.
 ** Only report on referenced unsupported custom fields

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
All custom and standard fields are migrated every time a migration is run. This means that fields not required by the selected projects are migrated, resulting in longer migration runs, high risk of project migration failure and a higher burden on Cloud performance.

If the field is supported - it can create noise in the destination instance by migrating fields that are not used by any project. 
If the field is unsupported - it can create noise in the pre and post migration ‘Requires Attention' report by reporting to the customer that the field config won’t be migrated and that they should either fix/clean-up the issue unnecessarily. {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Delete the custom fields that are not required post-migration.
fields.summary: All standard and custom fields are migrated every time a migration is run

fields.description: Currently the attachment failure logs in Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant are not very end-user friendly and customers need to contact Atlassian Support to review and understand the logs.
fields.summary: Add detailed logging for attachment failures in Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant.

fields.description:

# Run a Jira Site import to a site that never received an import before.
# Once import is completed, go ahead and run another import. Do not approve/reject all groups under instance's Product Access configuration.

h3. Expected Results
Import completes successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Import fails.

The below exception is thrown in Jira UI:
{noformat}
Error importing data: cloud.atlassian.logmon.laas.api.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException
{noformat}

The below Stack Trace is thrown in Jira logs (backend):
{noformat}
cloud.atlassian.logmon.laas.api.PrivacySafeException: Privacy-safe boxing of a com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.handleAuthorizationError(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:306)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.withRetry(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:287)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.DefaultIdpSafeOperations.requestGroupAccessToProduct(DefaultIdpSafeOperations.java:155)

	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.updateGroupPermissions(IdentityImportHelper.java:212)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.identity.IdentityImportHelper.performMigration(IdentityImportHelper.java:141)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:511)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.performTasksOnImportDb(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:627)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.CloudImportTaskRunner.lambda$null$1(CloudImportTaskRunner.java:259)
	at com.atlassian.connpool.impl.AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:155)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$null$0(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:63)
	at java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$runWithSeparateContextAsync$1(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:62)
	at java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1604)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating a big amount of projects/attachments with JCMA the add-on might fail to migrate the projects and throw the below export error:
{code}
2020-09-10 16:22:07.547 ERROR ABC attachment-export We couldn't export Attachment 'A.jpg' (on Issue ABC-128654). Reason: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.AttachmentReadException: com.atlassian.jira.migration.mediaclient.MediaClientErrorException: request to Media failed.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a migration plan.
# Migrate a few projects.

h3. Expected Results

JCMA should be able to migrate the attachments and projects without issues.

h3. Actual Results

JCMA fails when exporting attachmetns and in the JIRA applications logs we can see the below error:
{code}
2020-09-10 10:22:07,557-0600 pool-5532-thread-5 WARN user@abc.com 391x446976x3 1hkyydu 10.57.121.10 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [c.a.j.m.workers.attachments.AttachmentProcessor] d0dd5208-6885-4a17-abaf-315b4f3d0ab2-attachmentsUpload#ABC$ecxxxxxxc100c6f054333c49111bb5e6ce654b6ceff2b0db121f1748e305e: error in attachments upload task for project key ABC
com.atlassian.jira.migration.workers.attachments.AttachmentUploadException: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.AttachmentReadException: com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.AttachmentReadException:
......
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.migration.httpclient.exceptions.UnexpectedStatusCodeException: Received an unexpected status code; expected [200, 409], but received 404: {"error":{"code":"NotFoundError","title":"The Upload with the given xxxx-f84b-43eb-962b-1a0c7c043416 does not exist","href":"https://api.media.atlassian.com#NotFoundError"}}
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.httpclient.exceptions.ExceptionsKt.unexpectedStatusCode(Exceptions.kt:7)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.httpclient.MigrationPluginHttpClient.checkExpectedResponseCode(MigrationPluginHttpClient.kt:136)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.httpclient.MigrationPluginHttpClient.execute(MigrationPluginHttpClient.kt:65)
	at com.atlassian.jira.migration.mediaclient.MediaClient.execute(MediaClient.kt:181)
	... 13 more
{code}

h3. Notes

The issue is transient and it won't necessarily affect the same attachment.
So far it seems like the migration duration is related to the issue.

h3. Workaround

Retry the migration for the affected projects. JCMA should only migrate the missing attachments so it should take way less time and it should also go through.
fields.summary: JCMA project migration fails with "request to Media failed"

fields.description:
The Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant does not migrate app data. Some Confluence apps do not require data migration; others will need additional support from the Marketplace Partner who developed and maintains the app.

To see the list of apps with available migration paths, see [this knowledge base article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/server-to-cloud-migrations-atlassian-marketplace-apps-that-are-available-in-cloud-with-migration-paths-1018763154.html].
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant does not migrate app data

fields.description:
The Jira Cloud Migration Assistant does not migrate app data. Some Jira apps do not require data migration; others will need additional support from the Marketplace Partner who developed and maintains the app. 

To see the list of apps with available migration paths, see [this knowledge base article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/server-to-cloud-migrations-atlassian-marketplace-apps-that-are-available-in-cloud-with-migration-paths-1018763154.html].
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Migration Assistant does not migrate app data

fields.description:
The [App Migration Platform|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/getting-started/about/] allows Marketplace Partners to build automated migration paths for migrating app data from server to cloud. In order to facilitate the migration, Atlassian may provide a mapping file, which translates server IDs to cloud IDs. 

The mappings file which Atlassian produces for Confluence migrations does not include custom content types which are used by some apps.
fields.summary: App Migration Platform does not provide mappings for custom content types

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, Jira Cloud Migration Assistant doesn't support the migration of Automation Rules from Jira Automation and it would require manual work.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Support the export/import of Jira Automation data
* Ability to migrate Jira Automation data using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

h3. Why this is important
* Automation for Jira is largely used in Server environments
* When we perform the migration from Server to Cloud, we are hoping to minimize the data loss after the migration.
fields.summary: Support the Migration of Automation Rules from Jira Automation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When creating a migration plan in the current version of JCMA(1.4.1) there's no option to select all projects from the server instance and if the user wants to have all projects migrated in the same plan he needs to go over all pages of projects and use the checkbox on the top to select all projects from that page.

This becomes quite toilsome when the server instance has a lot of projects.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the option to select *all* projects. Another good improvement would be to add keyboards shortcuts for the project list so users can move more quickly between the pages.

 
h2. Workaround

The dropdown arrow immediately to the right of the top-level checkbox allows the user to select all of the projects in the server instance.
fields.summary: Add option to include all projects in a migration plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to our documentation when doing a space import using Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, even by selecting the option to not migrate users, users that have content on the spaces migrated would be created on the destination Cloud, they would not have the group membership migrated but the accounts should be created as active but without product access.

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-26 at 15.14.24.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using CCMA create a plan to migrate spaces from Confluence Server to Cloud.
# Chose not to migrate users
# Verify on the Cloud if the users were migrated

h3. Expected Results

Users would be migrated without any groups, and thus not have product access, they would be active users.

As per our documentation: [Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/cloud-migration-assistant-for-confluence-973486571.html]

{quote}
*Selecting no users*

When you select none under users and groups, we will still migrate some user data connected to the spaces you are migrating. This is to make sure that mentions, comments, and page history stay active.

User data that will be migrated every time includes:

- full name
- username (discarded after migration)
- email address

We will only migrate this information for users directly connected to the spaces you are migrating. We will not give these users product access or add them to any groups. They will appear in your cloud site user list.

If you choose to migrate users later, their product and group access will be updated.

Also, if you choose not to migrate users and groups and you have a space permission granted by a group that don't exist in cloud, the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant will not migrate the respective space permission. To avoid this scenario, we recommend you to create the specific group in the cloud site before migration.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results

Users are not migrated, during the test only one account out of 3 was created.

h3. Workaround

Inviting the accounts with the same email as in the server will link the content to the users.
fields.summary: When doing a migration without users using CCMA users are not visible in the admin area

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The report generated when JCMA is “Checking for anonymous access” is listing some filters multiple times. 

It would be much friendlier if each filter was listed only once. On our server, there are two shared filters called the same name (obviously with different Ids) so we cannot simply sort and remove duplicates.

As an enhancement:
 # a new column in the spreadsheet that takes me directly to the filter page. i.e. [https://HOST/secure/admin/filters/ViewSharedFilters.jspa?XXXXXX|https://jira.hexagonmi.com/secure/admin/filters/ViewSharedFilters.jspa] 

 # a quick fix option to replace the “Everyone” permission with either the default Jira user group (“jira-users”) or allow me to select one single group from those on the server. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run JCMA with the new Anonymous Access check feature

h3. Expected Results

An easier and more user-friendly method of displaying and fixing the data. 
h3. Actual Results

The data needs to be manually parsed and corrected.
h3. Workaround

Manually go through the data and fix the issues
fields.summary: Improve JCMA Anonymous access check

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a migration using Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence, you have the option to migrate users and groups altogether, however, for some customers, this may not be possible due to several reasons, accounts without email, users using the same email, etc.

In those circumstances, customers may opt to chose not to migrate users and groups, however, if a space has permissions tied to a group that doesn't exist in the Cloud, a custom group, these permissions will not be migrated since the group will not be created during the space import process.

 !Screen Shot 2020-09-17 at 15.18.43.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space in Confluence Server
 # Create a custom group 
# Assign this group to grant permission on the space
# Migrate the space to Cloud not migrating users and groups.

h3. Expected Results

The permissions will be added in the space in the Cloud and the corresponding group would be created.

h3. Actual Results

Space permission is not carried over, which can cause problems while accessing the space.

h3. Workaround

Create the groups before you migrate the spaces, [you can contact support|http://support.atlassian.com], or attempt to use our [Confluence REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-group/#api-api-group-post] the groups need to be created with the exact casing as in the server.

SQL query to extract group permissions in spaces:

{code}
select s.spacekey, s.spacename, permtype, permgroupname
from spacepermissions sp
join spaces s on sp.spaceid = s.spaceid;
{code}
fields.summary: When doing a migration without migrating groups and users space permissions will not be migrated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating projects with [Jira Cloud Migration Assistant|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/use-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-to-migrate-from-server-to-cloud-993925215.html], the plugin should only migrate entities related to the selected projects. This also means that only the Issue Types referenced in these project workflows should be migrated when a given project is selected. Currently, all migrations with the migration assistant are bringing over all [Issue types|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/issue-types-844500742.html]' each time any migration is ran which can create duplicates on the target.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a specific issue type and associated it with a non-migrating project
 # Install Jira Cloud Migration Assistant and migrate a project that doesn't have the issue type from step 1

h3. Expected Results

Only the issue types associated with selected projects will be migrated.
h3. Actual Results

All issue types are migrated with any run of Jira Cloud Migration Assistant whether the selected project includes them or not.
h3. Workaround

Delete the excessive issue types that are not required in *post migration*.
fields.summary: All issue types migrated every time a migration is run

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a page contains a template macro, CCMA will migrate this data into the Cloud. The macro button will work correctly on the live page. However, if a user selects Edit and tries to edit the macro, the template name will default to 90-day plan. Without making any changes, if the user were to save while in the edit macro mode, the new template will get saved overriding the true template.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Confluence Server, create test page
# Insert 'Create from template' macro. Create Meeting Notes template
# Publish page
** Selecting the button on live page will correctly open meeting notes template
# Use CCMA to migrate Space with test page
# On Confluence Cloud, the button on live page will correctly open meeting notes template

h3. Actual Results
In edit mode, selecting to edit the macro shows 90-day plan template
If user were to save at this point, without making any changes, the templates gets updated to 90-day plan.

h3. Expected Results
In edit mode, selecting to edit the macro should show same meeting notes template

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: After CCMA migration 'Create from template' macro is inconsistent in live page compared with edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It would be great if the Jira site import would fix the invalid XML characters rather than failing the validation

h3. Suggestion Details
Currently the import errors out if the backup files (entities.xml or activeobjects.xml) have any invalid characters. The fix is usually cleaning the XML files using the xml cleaner from this KB - https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/removing-invalid-characters-from-xml-backups-12079.html
fields.summary: It would be great if the Jira site import would fix the invalid XML characters rather than failing the validation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the merge users option on site import, the import failed if the Atlassian Account ID already exists on the target site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some users on Jira Cloud
 # Take a backup from Jira Server, that contains the same users but with different usernames
# Import the backup into Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Import completed successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Import failed at synchronizing users and groups stage.
* Jira logs:
{code}
{"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"409","scimType":"uniqueness","detail":"Duplicate email address: abc@example.com","errorType":"UserAlreadyExists","message":"Duplicate email address: abc@example.com","data":"abc@example.com"} 
{code}
* User Management logs:
{code}
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.UserAlreadyExistsException: User already exists in directory [-1] with name [abc@example.com]
{code}

Note:
* Scenario 1: An active user, with the same email address (but different user name), already exist on the target Cloud site. 
* Scenario 2: A deleted user, with the same AAID as the target email address, already exists
on target Cloud site.

Jira failed the user sync instead of merging the user.

h3. Workaround
# Clean up the users on Jira Cloud
# Contact Atlassian Support to perform the manual user import as per [How to bulk import your users before migrating|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/determine-your-user-migration-strategy-991930388.html#Determineyourusermigrationstrategy-Howtobulkimportyourusersbeforemigrating]
# Clean up the users from the backup file
# Perform the import again
fields.summary: Jira Site Import Failed with Duplicate email address, When Using Merge Users option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating Space using CCMA, the create/update Date and Time show time differential depending on time from Server. For example, when migrating a newly created test page, instead of showing ~4 minutes in Confluence Cloud, the time shows 4 hours. This appears to be due to the fact that the server setenv.sh has been configured with the value: 
{code:java}
-Duser.timezone=America/New_York
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure *setenv.sh* with the value:

{code:java}
-Duser.timezone=America/New_York{code}

according to KB: [Set the timezone for the Java environment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/set-the-timezone-for-the-java-environment-323392719.html]
 # Create a new test page
 # Migrate Space with test page using CCMA

h3. Expected Results

The migrated Cloud Space should contain the page and reflect create/update time accurately
h3. Actual Results
If the page was created at 1 pm NY time, it becomes created at 1pm GMT in the Cloud

h3. Workaround
Removing the manual configuration (Duser.timezone) in setenv.sh appears to eliminate the problem
fields.summary: Migration with CCMA shows incorrect timezone after migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When doing a space import on Cloud, the space import process fails with the error message: 

"Error: The scope of the import extends outside of the space."

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This 

h3. Expected Results

Space import would work

h3. Actual Results

The space import fails, Cloud logs are as follows:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: The scope of the import extends outside of the space.

Caused by: com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.preprocessor.space.entityvalidation.ValidationException: Permission type not allowed: xxxxxxxxx
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Space import fails with "Error: The scope of the import extends outside of the space."

fields.description:
Currently, the [Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219672/confluence-cloud-migration-assistant?tab=overview&hosting=server] will migrate only complete spaces, it would be great if it will be possible to also migrate content from the server to cloud existing spaces under the already created structure.

The goal will be to migrate just a specific content and sub-pages to already existing space structure in a Confluence Cloud site.
fields.summary: Migrate the content of the specific page in a space and all sub-pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New migration code in Confluence Cloud has been found to not correctly import content properties. This leads to some functionality not appearing correctly (e.g., attachments on view page, inline comments).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # CMAC migration

h3. Expected Results

Content properties migrated correctly.

h3. Actual Results

The underlying issue is that content properties for content imported in the new process did not correctly get associated back to the content itself. There is no actual loss of data (attachments, inline comments, etc), only a disconnect in metadata for the content (content properties not associated with their content id).

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Content properties not migrated correctly
Unable to parse QuickFilter JQL when filter assignee reference appears as user@domain.com

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now all customers are obligated to apply updates before running a migration with JCMA(JIRA Cloud migration assistant). This is not a direct problem but for customers that have been testing migrations with a specific version, it would be best to ignore updates when closer to the production migration in order to avoid unexpected errors.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option within the add-on so customers can ignore updates.
fields.summary: Add option to ignore updates in the JIRA migration assistant add-on

fields.description:
h3. Summary

During a site import, external directory users are not imported into the Cloud active directory, they can only be imported by support, this is a known issue as per this feature request: [JRACLOUD-71339 - It would be great if users managed by an external directory in Jira would be imported during site import|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71339]

This is so crucial for a successful migration that we have specific documentation for it:

- https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/determine-your-user-migration-strategy-991930388.html

h3. Expected Results

The expected results would be that the users would be normally imported, however, in the absence of that, having a banner warning the customer about this would be great.

 !Screen Shot 2020-08-20 at 11.56.07.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Users are not properly imported and the content to the user doesn't get properly associated.

h3. Workaround

If you are doing a migration contact [support|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/] first to import the users beforehand.
fields.summary: Add a banner after Jira site import validation to warn customers who have external directories

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As part of the migration flow, the CCMA(Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant) needs to check if the selected spaces already exist in the target Cloud site to avoid errors during the import. 

Right now, these checks might pass even though space already exists in the Cloud site with the same Space key you're migrating.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Cloud space
# Edit the Cloud space permissions so the site-admin user being used by CCMA doens't have the *view* permission on the Cloud space.
# Create a server space with the same space key as the one in Cloud.
# Create a new migration plan and migrate the Server space.

h3. Expected Results

CCMA should be able to identify the existing space in the Cloud.

h3. Actual Results

The Space key checks pass and the migration fails with *Cloud site already has this space*:
 !Image 2020-08-18 at 6.16.29 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Make sure the site-admin user has the required permissions in all Cloud spaces.
As a site admin, you can [recover space permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/assign-space-permissions/#AssignSpacePermissions-managepermManageandrecoverspaceadminpermissions] if needed.
fields.summary: Check for existing spaces gives false positive in migration assistant

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Site import gets stuck at the Users and group sync stage

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate a Jira server backup
 # Import backup to cloud

h3. Expected Results
* Backup is imported fine and doesn't time out. 

h3. Actual Results
* Backup is stuck at the Users and group stage 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Site import gets stuck at the Users and group sync stage

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JCMA is currently not migrating issue types' icons.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a jira project on server
# Create some new issue types and associated them to that project
# Change the issue type icons to other options available from JIRA
# Migrate the project to Cloud via JCMA

h3. Expected Results

The issue types should be migrated with their respective icons.

h3. Actual Results

The issue types icons are all defaulted to one in Cloud and not even the default issue types get the correct icon:
 !image-2020-08-13-19-09-59-468.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Manually customize the issue type icons in Cloud.
fields.summary: JCMA is not migrating issue types' icons

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JCMA won't migrate project avatars as stated [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-993925216.html].

h3. Suggested Solution

Add this functionality to the JIRA migration assistant as manually migrating project avatars can be quite toilsome depending on how many projects get migrated.
fields.summary: Add support to migrate project avatars with JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you move an issue to a new project and migrate both the original and new projects from Server to Cloud using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant app, there will be no history of the project change on the destination Cloud site. Users are unable to search for the ticket in the new project using the original issue key nor are they able to use any URLs referencing the old key to be redirected to the new project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move issue from project A to project B
 # Migrate project A and project B from Server to Cloud using JCMA

h3. Expected Results

Activity tab shows change in project and issue key
 URLs with old issue key redirects to new issue key
 Searching for old issue key returns new issue key

!Screen Shot 2020-08-12 at 5.43.48 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

No mention of change to project or issue key in activity tab
 URLs with old issue key do not redirect
 Searching for old issue keys do not return new issue key

!Screen Shot 2020-08-12 at 5.42.50 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Migration Assistant does not migrate historical changes to an issue's project key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Site import does not change all base url changes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a server instance add links between jira issues. 
# Add a link to another issue using the link functionality
# Add a link to another issue comments or description
# Create a backup on Server 
# Import backup to Cloud. 
# Site import will detect the correct number of links referencing the base url in the processing stage. 
# Choose the base url of your server instance

h3. Expected Results
* All links are updated to the new cloud base url

h3. Actual Results
* Only links in the issue links section are updated
* Links in the comments and description section are not updated. 

h3. Workaround
Contact atlassian support to find a way to detect and fix these links.
fields.summary: Jira Site import does not change all base url changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to re-import a project with JCMA, active/future/closed sprints might drift from the original migration and cause issues such as this one:
{code:java}
2020-08-03 18:56:24.134 ERROR MOVE project-import We couldn't import Issue MOVE-2. Reason: Issue can be assigned to only closed sprints, and one active or future sprint during migration.. This caused 7 other items to fail.
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate a project with an active sprint and a future sprint using JCMA  !image-2020-08-03-14-02-29-016.png|width=732,height=376!
 # Once migrated, delete the project (this is a common step done by customers who are done testing the migration of that project)
 # Note: the sprint data remains in Cloud after the project is deleted  !image-2020-08-03-14-04-29-178.png|width=1016,height=732!
 # Complete the Active sprint in Server
 # Add MOVE-2 to the future sprint in Server (e.g. edit the Sprint field)
    !move-2.png|width=283,height=193!
 !image-2020-08-03-14-09-04-613.png|width=384,height=245!
 # Re-migrate the project
 # The migration will fail with 
{code:java}
2020-08-03 18:56:24.134 ERROR MOVE project-import We couldn't import Issue MOVE-2. Reason: Issue can be assigned to only closed sprints, and one active or future sprint during migration.. This caused 7 other items to fail.{code}

*This is just one of many scenarios that may lead to these drifts.
h3. Expected Results

JCMA should re-migrate the entire project and its Sprint to issue associations
h3. Actual Results

There are unhandled exceptions where JCMA thinks the following condition is not met, even though MOVE-2 is only assigned to a *Closed* and an *Active* sprint in Server.

"An issue can only be assigned to one active sprint or future sprint. This means you can't add an issue to both an active sprint and a future sprint at the same time."

!image-2020-08-03-14-13-09-447.png|width=204,height=171!

Also notice that the same sprint is now shown as Active in Server and Future in Cloud, with the missing issue not present.

*Server - Active*
 !server.png|thumbnail!

*Cloud - Future*
 !cloud.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Re-migrating a project should also re-migrate sprint data
