fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When having the default *Story* issue type name changed in server, it is possible to run into import issues with JCMA if another issue type gets created with the *Story* name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit server default {color:#0747a6}Story{color} issue type to another name(e.g {color:#0747a6}JIRA's original Story{color}).
 # Create another issue type called {color:#de350b}Story{color}
 # Create a project associated with the two issue types.
 # Create issues under the new {color:#de350b}Story{color} and in the {color:#0747a6}JIRA's original Story types.{color}
 # Migrate the project to Cloud with JCMA.
 
 h3. Expected Results
 
 The project should be migrated with the two issue types respecting all the issues and project configurations set for each.
 h3. Actual Results
 
 The issues within each of the issue types are merged and migrated as the default *Story* issue type in the target Cloud site.
 Some issues that were associated with JIRA's original Story might not be migrated

!Server-workflows.png|thumbnail! !Cloud-workflows.png|thumbnail! 
 !server-issue.png|thumbnail! !cloud-issue.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

This issue can cause workflows to get migrated and associated with the wrong issue types which cause errors like this:
{code:java}
2020-07-29 22:12:55.566 ERROR KCA project-import We couldn't import Issue KCA-10. Reason: NullPointerException: There is no step in workflow [jira (migrated)] linked to status [Done]. This caused 4 other items to fail.
{code}
{code:java}
Chunk Migration Error: reason='NullPointerException: There is no step in workflow [T Worflow] linked to status [Done]', actionToResolve='null', numDownstreamFailures=20)	
{code}
Basically, JCMA manages to migrate the issue but it gets associated with the incorrect workflow because of the missing issue type and therefore can't be transitioned to its original status.
h3. Workaround

Change the new issue type {color:#de350b}Story{color} in server into something else and migrate again.
fields.summary: JCMA fails to migrate issue type when default Story issue type has been edited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a component is migrated using JCMA, the customer would expect it to be migrated as per the logic documented here - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/how-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-links-your-data-993925217.html] 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a migration with a few projects
 # Run another migration
 # Run yet another migration

h3. Expected Results

When a component is migrated the first time, the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant records the mapping and for subsequent migrations, it should link to the component as per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/how-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-links-your-data-993925217.html]
h3. Actual Results

We don't provide users with options to merge their configurations in any way. Following are some scenarios where duplication of components occur:
 * The Default Configurations of Jira are always duplicated in the first migration, i.e., they are migrated again with a <component> + (migrated) appended to each subsequent migration.
 * Clean-up after first migration by Jira Admins result in them deleting unnecessary configurations in cloud. This can lead to failed migrations and subsequent clean-up of ID-mappings in JCMA. In the subsequent migrations, these components are migrated again with a <component> + (migrated) appended due to namespace clashes.
 * Merging different server/cloud instances in cloud leads to possible namespace clashes, resulting in components being migrated again with a <component> + (migrated) appended to it.

h3. Workaround

Clean up in Cloud post-migration by renaming and merging data by performing bulk issue updates and component names in project settings.
fields.summary: Each time I run a migration, components are unnecessarily duplicated

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating projects with JCMA the issues and their history are all imported correctly but the author of each action in the history is not correctly associated with the migrated user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project in server
# Create some issues and transition then through the workflow
# Migrate the project with JCMA

h3. Expected Results

The issues and their history ownership should be migrated fine.

h3. Actual Results

The issues and their history are migrated but the ownership is lost.
Before(server):
 !server.png|thumbnail! 

After(Cloud):
 !cloud.png|thumbnail! 

Note that the issue assignee and reporter get mapped correctly.

h3. Workaround

[Contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/].
fields.summary: History of issues migrated with JCMA is not correctly associated with users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now the information of a migration plan that's available in JCMA(JIRA Cloud migration Assistant) is pretty limited and users can see mostly summaries of about the project migrations but there are no dates.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the migration start and end date to JCMA migration plans so admins can have a better idea of when certain projects were migrated.
fields.summary: Add migration start and end date to migration plans

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In many cases, admins are required to migrate the Confluence data between different instances in order to:
* Merge the instances - 
** Company acquired another company, and each company has their own Atlassian instance
** Different teams are working on different instances, and the company would like to consolidate the instances into one
* Split the instance -
** to transfer the the space ownership to third-party

It's not feasible to perform the space migration one-by-one, especially when it comes to large spaces or when it has hundreds of spaces to migrate. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Support Cloud Migration Assistant app in Cloud version

h3. Why this is important
* To improve the migration experience in Confluence Cloud
* Reduce the time needed for the manual space migration
fields.summary: Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence support for Cloud version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When migrating projects with JCMA if the migrating project has comments mentioning issues from projects that were not migrated yet, those comments will be converted into text and won't have an actual link to those issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project A and project B.
# Create an issue in each project.
# Comment in the issues and use the issue key from the issue created in the counterpart project. JIRA should turn the issue key into a direct link to the issue.
# Migrate project A with JCMA.
# Migrate project B with JCMA in a separate plan.

h3. Expected Results

Both issues should be migrated and the comments on each should have a direct link to the issue.

h3. Actual Results

Only the issue from project B will have a valid link.
Since projet A was migrated when project B didn't exist at the instance the issue-key remains as plain text on the project A comments.

h3. Workaround

It's possible to work around this issue by migrating the two projects in the same plan. But for a large instance, it should be difficult to migrate all projects at once.
fields.summary: JIRA issue comment links to other issues are not always updated when migrating

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now the JIRA Cloud migration assistant doens't have any public REST endpoints to facilitate tasks when working in extent migrations

h3. Suggested Solution

Create public endpoints for the assistance so users can submit new plans and check information from past migrations as well as consult the current mappings for entities that were already migrated.
fields.summary: Create REST API endpoints for the migration assistant

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, all projects that get migrated with the JIRA Cloud migration assistant will not migrate project notification schemes so all migrated projects will be associated with the default notification scheme in the target Cloud site.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the migration assistant add-on so custom notification schemes are also imported to the Cloud.

h3. Workaround 

Manually re-create the notification scheme in Cloud and associate it to the migrated projects.
fields.summary: Add the ability to migrate notification schemes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing a migration from JCMA, we observe the error as shown in the screenshot below:
{code}
[user, group] migration completed: failure - 400 Bad Request from POST https://users-migration-service.prod.atl-paas.net/api/users/migration/jira
{code}
 !jira_migration (1).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* The issue appears when jira server has invalid users with the email address domain like  @...localhost , @...localdomain , @dummy.local.
* Run the Jira Cloud Migration assistant, to migrate users and project to the Cloud site.
* Run the Migration plan.

h3. Expected Results
Jira cloud migration assistant detects these invalid emails during pre-flight checks. 

h3. Actual Results
We observe the error below when migration users and groups:
 {code} [user, group] migration completed: failure - 400 Bad Request from POST https://users-migration-service.prod.atl-paas.net/api/users/migration/jira 
{code}

h3. Workaround. 
None. 
Contact Atlassian support so they can help investigate this through the logs.
fields.summary: Error : failure - 400 Bad Request from POST https://users-migration-service.prod.atl-paas.net/api/users/migration/jira when using Jira Cloud Migration assistant

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The JCMA project selector page ([http://HOST/secure/migration-app-action.jspa#/project-selection)|http://10.125.91.238:8080/jira881/secure/migration-app-action.jspa#/project-selection)] can be slow to load if there's a lot of projects, issues or attachments present. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create plenty of projects e.g. 300
 # Create plenty of issues for these projects

h3. Expected Results

The project selector page loads within a reasonable time
h3. Actual Results

The page can take up to a couple of minutes to load. This is likely due to the queries it runs in the backend to retrieve project, issue and attachment stats.
h3. Workaround

Wait for the page to load
fields.summary: JCMA Project Selector Page can take a long time to load

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Error when importing Jira Server file into Cloud. Timestamp format must be yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.fffffffff]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export backup from Jira Server
# Extract file and grep for CustomFieldValue string in entities.xml
{code:java}
grep '<CustomFieldValue id=' entities.xml
{code}
 # XML file contain CustomField lines contain and update field which does not have the correct data format. Examples:
{code:java}
<CustomFieldValue id="13196957" issue="813688" customfield="10082" updated="1589885159355" stringvalue="10210"/>
<CustomFieldValue id="13196958" issue="813688" customfield="10021" updated="1589885159356" stringvalue="10019"/>
....
{code}
# Problem is this line:
{code}
updated="1589885159355"
{code}

h3. Expected Results
 * Jira Cloud to process the timestamp and convert it to the correct format. Previous fix on JRACLOUD-67557 allows import to proceed. Seems to be a regression

h3. Actual Results
 * Import fails with the following error:
 !error.png|thumbnail!
 * Related to previously fixed Server > Cloud import error: JRACLOUD-67557

h3. Additional Notes
This can happen for other date time stamp values besides custom field value. Please contact Atlassian support if you need help with identifying the corrupt dates from your backup file. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Import Error: Timestamp format must be yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss[.fffffffff]

fields.description:
When a migration from Jira Server to Jira Cloud takes place, the position of the statuses are changed and each of them is placed below the other one instead of keeping the existing configuration in terms of positioning.

This can be an issue when there is a considerable number of statuses and transitions as it might be hard to see how the workflow is designed and supposed to work.

It would be nice if Jira could store the positions in the diagram and keep those when the migration occurs.
fields.summary: Improve workflow UI positioning when migrating from Jira Server to Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud Migration assistant does not Migrate Roles under the People section of the projects
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Migrate a project From Server to Cloud.
 * Under the Users and Roles, we observe that the page has Users and groups added with required Roles
 * Migrate the project to Cloud site with Jira Cloud Migration assistant
 * Observe that Migration is succesfull with all the green checks

In the Cloud site
 * Go to the migrated project
 * Project settings --> people
 * Observe that the Page is empty

h3. Expected Results

Users and Roles should migrate successfully. And should have the same set of users and groups as that in the server.
h3. Actual Results

The people page is empty
h3. Workaround

*If you are using the Jira Migration Assistant 1.3.1 or older:*
 * This bug will not affect you. We have taken remediation steps to prevent new customers from upgrading to JCMA version 1.3.2

{color:#ff0000}*If you are using the Jira Migration Assistant 1.3.2:* {color}
 * A hotfix has just been release that fixes the issue. Upgrade to 1.3.3 of Jira Cloud Migration Assistant to fix MIG-216. [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1222010/jira-cloud-migration-assistant/version-history]
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Migration assistant on version 1.3.2 does not Migrate Roles under the People section of the projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
All default priorities are labelled with the migrated keyword after using JCMA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Sign up for a cloud site. 
 # Migrate a project with JCMA

h3. Expected Results
JCMA merges server and cloud priorities.

h3. Actual Results
# JCMA does not merge server and cloud priorities
# The priorities are migrated to cloud with a 'migrated' word at the end. 

h3. Workaround
# Manually cleanup cloud site to merge the priorities.
fields.summary: All default priorities are labelled with the migrated keyword after using JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Right now the migration assistant add-ons don't present the ability to delete or re-try migration plans.

This is not a major issue but would be a good enhancement so customers can better track which projects/spaces have been migrated so far and help them re-try failed migrations after applying a possible fix for the last issue that blocked the migration.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the add-ons so users can delete migration plans and re-try plans that failed previously.
fields.summary: Add ability to delete, edit or re-try migration plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a role is migrated using JCMA, there are situations where roles are migrated again with a <role_name> + (migrated) appended to each subsequent migration. This causes a lot of post-migration cleanup. The de-duplication process is tedious & risky as all of the duplicated role references in (multiple) project settings needs to be carefully remapped to the original role before deleting the duplicates. This gets onerous when many roles and projects are migrated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a migration with a few projects
 # When a role is migrated the first time along with these first few projects, the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant records the mapping and for subsequent migrations, it re-links to the role as per [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/how-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-links-your-data-993925217.html]
 # At times, Atlassian Support may be contacted for troubleshooting and the mapping logic (scope table) is reset
 # This the results in <role_name> + (migrated 2)... and then (migrate 3), (migrated 4) each time the mapping logic is reset
 # De-duplicate roles in Cloud post-migration.

h3. Expected Results

 We are conducting customer interviews to develop improvements to:
 * *Default behaviour* as documented in [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/how-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-links-your-data-993925217.html] 
 * *<role_name> + (migrated) being appended* often results from re-migration or clean up situations where roles are being deleted and then migration scope tables are reset by Atlassian Support. We expect this to be mostly addressed in MIG-163 Better handling of deleted objects with the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant
 * *Potential improvements to enable you to make a decision on whether to merge an object or not.* Our current defaults are designed so that the migration does not disturb existing data already in your Jira Cloud site ie. by default we currently do not perform data merges on unrelated objects

Please comment if you have use cases you would like us to consider.
fields.summary: Each time I run a migration, roles are unnecessarily duplicated

fields.description:
Make Jira Cloud Migration Assistant Compatible with Jira 8.10. At the moment, this is only compatible with 8.9 and most of our recommendations are to install the latest version of Jira. [Versions Available|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1222010/jira-cloud-migration-assistant/version-history]

h3. Expected Solution
JCMA releases should align with Product releases in order to prevent friction.
fields.summary: Make Jira Cloud Migration Assistant Compatible with Jira 8.10

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In some cases, when migrating projects from Jira Server to Jira Cloud, you may notice a few issues missing comments, the project migration won't fail, however, you will be able to find an error on the server logs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Migrate projects from Jira Server to Cloud
# Validate the comments on the issues.

h3. Expected Results

All the comments get migrated.

h3. Actual Results

In some cases, we haven't been able to pinpoint exactly why this happens, you may notice a few missing comments on the issues.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:

{noformat}
ERROR projectkey project-import We couldn't import Comment
id (on Issue issuekey by 'Username' on 2019-11-22T22:46:40Z).
Reason: QueryException: Caught BatchUpdateException for insert into
"public"."jiraaction" ("issueid", "author", "actiontype",
"actionlevel", "rolelevel", "actionbody", "created", "updateauthor",
"updated", "actionnum", "tokens", "actionbody_adf",
"actionbody_adf_id", "actionbody_adf_version")
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Export the issues with the missing comments from your Jira Server, in the [CSV format|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-csv-776636762.html] import back in the Cloud, you should only need the issue key, summary and the comments to update the missing comments on the Cloud.
fields.summary: JCMA may not migrate some comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When doing a migration using the Confluence Migration Assistant, there are times that a space migration fails, and you need to create a new plan with the remaining spaces, however, the search functionality inside the app is case sensitive, if you don't look for the space key with the same characters casing it will not show that particular space.

h3. Suggestion

If possible it would be nice to have an insensitive matching search where it will return the space even if you search using different character casing.

 !image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Search for spaces in Confluence Migration Assistant is case sensitive

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, as per this [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/how-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-links-your-data-993925217.html], if there is no record of the entity in the JMT then it remigrates it by adding name(migrated).

h3. Suggested Solution
There are customers who want to use the plugin for migrating projects in the Cloud site 
with existing data and this data can have entities common to the ones in the migration plan.
The plugin should link such entities with the existing ones rather than creating a new field.
OR an option can be provided to the customer if they want to link to an existing entity or remigrate it.

h3. Workaround 
NA
fields.summary: Map with existing entities even if the record is not found while migrating using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When JVM is configured with authenticated outbound proxy via system properties, CCMA can't connect to Migration App Aggregator, the service for collecting Marketplace and other data for App Assessment.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Confluence with [outbound http proxy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/how-to-configure-outbound-http-and-https-proxy-for-your-atlassian-application-834000120.html]
# Ensure that Web proxy requires any kind of authentication 
 # Navigate to Migration Assistant

h3. Expected Results

Access your Apps section should work
h3. Actual Results

The following error happens,
 !proxy-1-error.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Remove authentication from outbound proxies.
fields.summary: CCMA doesn't work with authenticated outbound HTTP proxy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While boards are migrated via JCMA if the board quick filters or main filter has the "was" clause the migration will fail because of the order that the migration add-on imports the data.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a software project in JIRA server.
 # At the project board, add a quick filter with the was a clause, e.g:
{code:java}
assignee was in (user)
{code}

 # Make sure at least one ticket matches the quick filter JQL.
 # Try to migrate the project using JCMA.

h3. Expected Results

The migration should succeed and the board should be imported with all JQL filters.
h3. Actual Results

The migration fails with:
{code:java}
Reason: query: The value xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxx' does not exist for the field 'assignee'.. This caused X other items to fail`.
{code}
h3. Workaround

Remove the "was" clause from the JQL filters using it and once the board is migrated add the filters back in Cloud.
fields.summary: Errors in board migration with JQLs containing "was" clause

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Project export fails in JCMA if attachments referenced by the project’s issues have null MIME type in the Jira DB.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Run the migration plan from Jira Server using JCMA, it will fail in project export if attachments referenced by the project’s issues have null MIME type in the Jira DB.

h3. Expected Results

JCMA should assign a default MIME type and the project should get imported to Cloud with no issues.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the log file:
{noformat}
ERROR XYZ project-export We couldn't export File Attachment 'ABC' (on Issue XYZ). Reason: java.lang.IllegalStateException: entity.mimetype must not be null.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * Use {{SELECT * FROM FILEATTACHMENT WHERE MIMETYPE IS NULL}} query to find attachments with null MIME type.
 * Use {{UPDATE FILEATTACHMENT SET MIMETYPE = 'application/octet-stream' WHERE MIMETYPE IS NULL}} query to assign a MIME type to those attachments. Specify more suitable MIME type value if possible, e.g. {{image/png}}, {{text/plain}}, etc. Empty string also seems to work and Media will/should detect the right type anyways.
fields.summary: Project export fails if attachment mimetype is null
When the customer is trying to use the App "Time In Status" by OBSS, they are getting an error in the page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA) is requiring an update during the pre-flight checks before a migration is possible. However, the option to upgrade the app is not possible through the UI. This appears t be affecting all users using JCMA.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Jira Server instance with a pre-existing JCMA app on any version besides 1.2.0
 # Try to perform a migration

h3. Expected Results
The migration pre-fligh checks will prompt for an upgrade and allow the user to upgrade the app via the user interface.

h3. Actual Results
The user interface does not allow the user to upgrade the app and will not allow admins to migrate anything without the most recent release.


h3. Workaround

Manually install the latest app from https://marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com/files/artifact/5054e48a-5dd1-4c17-a440-cc2a06b2d09d/jira-migration-plugin-1.2.0.jar
fields.summary: JCMA Upgrade Required but not possible through UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing Jira's Base URL and trying to build a new migration plan, the *Migrate from* field will keep reflecting the old Base URL, preventing the migration from happening.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the base URL from Address A to Address B. Example: From http://HOSTA:8080/jira to http://HOSTB:9090/jira
 # Create a new migration plan.

h3. Expected Results

In the Choose a Cloud Site screen, the *Migrate from* shows http://HOSTB:9090/jira

h3. Actual Results

In the Choose a Cloud Site screen, the *Migrate from* shows http://HOSTA:8080/jira instead.
h3. Workaround

*Option One:*
 Re-install the migration assistant.

*Option Two:*
 In the create a migration screen, modify URL and put the updated and correct baseURL right after the *continue=* part. 

Example:
{code:java|title=From}
https://migration.atlassian.com/setup?back.........&continue=http://HOSTA:8080/jira/migration-cloud-save-action.jspa?nonceXXXXXX&product=jira&sen=XXXXXX
{code}

{code:java|title=To}
https://migration.atlassian.com/setup?back.........&continue=http://HOSTB:9090/jira/migration-cloud-save-action.jspa?nonceXXXXXX&product=jira&sen=XXXXXX
{code}
fields.summary: Jira migration assistant does not recognise base URL changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When reviewing and approving the default access groups post-migration, nothing happens, it's necessary to click multiple times to get the groups approved.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a site import in Jira
# Go to the page to approve groups
# Click to approve the default access groups

h3. Expected Results

The groups would be approved and the screen would show that right away.

h3. Actual Results

There are no refreshes in the box of the approval, which leads to a bad UX as the customers don't know if the groups were really approved.

h3. Workaround

Although it seems like the groups were not approved, if you click outside the box, refresh the page and click to approve the remaining groups it will get it through.

*Note*

Some times a warning message appears:

 !Screen Shot 2020-06-04 at 12.49.29.png|thumbnail! 

Looking at the browser console error displayed is a 412 response, that has the following error message:

{code}
{"key":"preconditionFailed","context":{"message":"PRECONDITION FAILED"}}
{code}

Retrying should work in these cases.
fields.summary: When approving default access groups post-migration nothing happens

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to re-import a project with JCMA if a Sprint was deleted after a previous import, it won't be imported again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Migrate any project with an active sprint.
# Close the active.
# Delete the closed sprint in Cloud (from step 2).
# Delete the full project.
# Re-migrate the project 

h3. Expected Results

JCMA should re-migrate the entire project and its Sprint.

h3. Actual Results

The active sprint from server is not present on cloud. All issues that were in the active sprint will be moved to the project backlog.
fields.summary: Re-migrating a project won't re-import Sprint membership

fields.description:

When running JCMA 1.1.4 on a Jira server instance on Oracle DB, no projects show up in the project selection page.

The customer can select projects for migrations.

!image-2020-05-26-17-17-17-479.png|width=810,height=457!

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some customers are facing a problem when migrating space via Confluence Migration assistant after the migration is successfully completed some attachments are missing in the destination Cloud site.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Migrate spaces using CCMA
# Verify the pages 
# Random pages will be missing attachments

h3. Expected Results

The Assistant would fail to migrate that particular space, forcing a re-migration for that particular space.

h3. Actual Results

The spaces are migrated successfully, even if the assistant failed to read an attachment.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:

{noformat}
com.atlassian.migration.agent.service.stepexecutor.attachment.AttachmentDataProvider$AttachmentDataRetrievalException: Could not get attachment 289965820 data
.....
{noformat}

You should see several of those exceptions in the logs.

h3. Workaround

Remigrate the affected spaces or manually upload the files to the destination pages.

You might need to clear out the MIG_ATTACHMENT table on your server to avoid previous results to interfere in your next runs.

1. Shutdown Confluence
2. Access your database
3. Run {code}DELETE FROM MIG_ATTACHMENT;{code}

This table is specific of the Migration Assistant, and it records the attachments migration.
fields.summary: Missing attachments in Confluence after migrating via Assistant

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
It would be great if my attachments could be front loaded before a migration.

h3. Details
# Attachments are migrated along with the spaces (CCMA) and projects (JCMA) and have to be uploaded after the migration in site-import.
# These attachments are usually large in size and the upload time is quite significant. 

It would be a big time saver if these were uploaded before the migration and linked during the prod migration.
fields.summary: It would be great if my attachments could be front loaded before a migration.
